column4: Hey guys can i change the location of where ubuntu software centre downloads and installs files?
Hey guys can i change the location of where ubuntu software centre downloads and installs files?
not really. You could change the cache location withs ome links.
thanks for the reply! Thats a shame, what will happen when the hard drive fills up? I wont be able to install any more applications?
if your HD is full.. you got bigger issues i imagine
linux makes it trivial to move stuff like /tmp/ and /var/ and /home/ to other hard drives

I installed ubuntu side by side with windows, and i only chose 10GB of space and i am really enjoying ubuntu, however i running out of space quickly, if i move directories across to my secondary hard drive, will the applications still work?
yes. if you do it right.. the power of mount and links :)
you should be learnng some more linux fundamentals.   'ln -s' is how to make a soft link from one location to a differnt location.
or you can move your /home/ to its own hard drive/partition  since most of the space will be the users stuff
will that cause any problems with dual booting or will i lose any data?
not if you do it right
wont i have to unmount that partition?
you dont resize a in use filesystem.. so yes.
/dev/sda3 is mount point /host, would that be the one i am looking to enlarge?
/host/ ? You did a WUBI install IN windows?
will that mean i have to create a live DVD
yes thats correct
i suggest doing a normal install.. and forgetting  wubi even exists..
i find that idea unsettling due to my knowledge and experience level
would it be possible to uninstall ubuntu (via window) then reinstall and select a more appropriate hard drive size?
